intro: Hedeoma palmeri var. galeana, commonly known as the Mexican mint marigold, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its leaves are hairy and have a strong, mint-like scent, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
